member.name: T:MsBuildPipeLogger.PipeLogger
member.summary: Logger to send messages from the MSBuild logging system over an anonymous pipe.
member.remarks: Heavily based on the work of Kirill Osenkov and the MSBuildStructuredLog project.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Build.Logging.BuildEventArgsFieldFlags
member.summary: A bitmask to specify which fields on a BuildEventArgs object are present; used in serialization.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Build.Logging.BuildEventArgsWriter
member.summary: Serializes BuildEventArgs-derived objects into a provided BinaryWriter.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Build.Logging.BuildEventArgsWriter.#ctor(System.IO.BinaryWriter)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of BuildEventArgsWriter with a BinaryWriter.
member.param: A BinaryWriter to write the BuildEventArgs instances to.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Build.Logging.BuildEventArgsWriter.Write(Microsoft.Build.Framework.BuildEventArgs)
member.summary: Write a provided instance of BuildEventArgs to the BinaryWriter.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Build.Logging.Reflector
member.summary: This class accesses the properties on event args that were added in MSBuild 15.3. As the StructuredLogger.dll references MSBuild 14.0 and gracefully degrades when used with MSBuild 14.0, we have to use Reflection to dynamically retrieve the values if present and gracefully degrade if we're running with an earlier MSBuild.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Build.Framework.Profiler.EvaluationIdProvider
member.summary: Assigns unique evaluation ids. Thread safe.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Build.Framework.Profiler.EvaluationIdProvider.GetNextId
member.summary: Returns a unique evaluation id.
member.remarks: The id is guaranteed to be unique across all running processes. Additionally, it is monotonically increasing for callers on the same process id.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Build.Framework.Profiler.EvaluationPass
member.summary: Evaluation main phases used by the profiler.
member.remarks: Order matters since the profiler pretty printer orders profiled items from top to bottom using the pass they belong to.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Build.Framework.Profiler.EvaluationLocationKind
member.summary: The kind of the evaluated location being tracked.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Build.Framework.Profiler.EvaluationLocation
member.summary: Represents a location for different evaluation elements tracked by the EvaluationProfiler.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Build.Framework.Profiler.EvaluationLocation.PassDefaultDescription
member.summary: Default descriptions for locations that are used in case a description is not provided.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Build.Framework.Profiler.EvaluationLocation.#ctor(System.Int64,System.Nullable{System.Int64},Microsoft.Build.Framework.Profiler.EvaluationPass,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.String,Microsoft.Build.Framework.Profiler.EvaluationLocationKind)
member.summary: Constructs a generic evaluation location.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Build.Framework.Profiler.EvaluationLocation.#ctor(System.Nullable{System.Int64},Microsoft.Build.Framework.Profiler.EvaluationPass,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.String,Microsoft.Build.Framework.Profiler.EvaluationLocationKind)
member.summary: Constructs a generic evaluation location based on a (possibly null) parent Id.
member.remarks: A unique Id gets assigned automatically Used by serialization/deserialization purposes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Build.Framework.Profiler.EvaluationLocation.#ctor(Microsoft.Build.Framework.Profiler.EvaluationPass,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.String,Microsoft.Build.Framework.Profiler.EvaluationLocationKind)
member.summary: Constructs a generic evaluation location with no parent.
member.remarks: A unique Id gets assigned automatically Used by serialization/deserialization purposes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Build.Framework.Profiler.EvaluationLocation.EmptyLocation
member.summary: An empty location, used as the starting instance.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Build.Framework.Profiler.ProfilerResult
member.summary: Result of profiling an evaluation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Build.Framework.Profiler.ProfiledLocation
member.summary: Result of timing the evaluation of a given element at a given location.

member.summary: Arguments for the project imported event.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ProjectImportedEventArgs class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Build.Framework.ProjectImportedEventArgs.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ProjectImportedEventArgs class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Build.Framework.ProjectImportedEventArgs.UnexpandedProject
member.summary: Gets or sets the original value of the Project attribute.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Build.Framework.ProjectImportedEventArgs.ImportedProjectFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the full path to the project file that was imported. Will be. null if the import statement was a glob and no files matched, or the condition (if any) evaluated to false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Build.Framework.ProjectImportedEventArgs.ImportIgnored
member.summary: Gets or sets if this import was ignored. Ignoring imports is controlled by. ProjectLoadSettings. This is only set when an import would have been included but was ignored to due being invalid. This does not include when a globbed import returned no matches, or a conditioned import that evaluated to false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Build.Framework.TargetBuiltReason
member.summary: The reason that a target was built by its parent target.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Build.Framework.TargetBuiltReason.None
member.summary: This wasn't built on because of a parent.

member.summary: The target was part of the parent's BeforeTargets list.

member.summary: The target was part of the parent's DependsOn list.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Build.Framework.TargetBuiltReason.AfterTargets
member.summary: The target was part of the parent's AfterTargets list.
